paper_abstract: We show that visio-spatial representations and reasoning can be used as a similarity metric for case-based protein structure prediction. Our system retrieves pairs of alpha-helices based on contact map similarity, then transfers and adapts the structure information to an unknown helix pair. We show that similar protein contact maps predict a similar three-dimensional protein structure. The success of this method provides support for the notion that changing representations can enable similarity metrics in case-based reasoning.
paper_title: Visio-spatial case-based reasoning: A case study in prediction of protein structure
